result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Brooks

records.addlTxt:
(2:23 PM cases 20CM1218, 21CF37, 21CF376, 21CF653, 22CF259 called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert L Brooks in court. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Robert L Brooks.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF259 and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF37 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine, 21CF376 Count 1: Delivery of Methamphetamine (<=3g) as a Second or Subsequent Offense, 21CF653 Count 3: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, 22CF259 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping and Count 4: Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500).
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF37 Count 1, 21CF376 Count 1, 21CF653 Count 3, 22CF259 Count 1 and Count 4.

Court orders sentence as follows on 21CF37 Count 1, 21CF653 Count 3, 22CF259 Count 1 and Count 4:
Defendant is to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include 1 bench warrant fee in 21CF37. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 21CF376 Count 1 for 36 months with the following conditions:
120 days jail, stayed pending further order of the Court. Restitution in the amounts of $175.31 in 21CF376 and $57.97 in 22CF259 to include 5% and 10% surcharges. $80.00 in buy funds to the WCDTF. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through with recommendations. No contact with H.R. or H.R.'s residence at 1317 1st Ave, Eau Claire, WI. No contact with A.S. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 4 days credit in 21CF37, 2 days credit in 21CF376, 4 days credit in 21CF653 and 2 days credit in 22CF259 if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including case 20CM1218 are dismissed and read in.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:35 AM cases 20CM1218, 22CF259, 21CF653, 21CF376, 21CF37 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert L Brooks in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Robert L Brooks. The warrant that was issued yesterday that was Stayed until Friday is quashed. Defense asks for one more return hearing. 
A status conference (possible plea) is scheduled for 5/26/22 at 2:00 PM.
Plea hearing on May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant ordered but stayed until 05/20/2022 at noon in all cases.

Conditions:
No contact with R.R., H.R. or their residence.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.
(Covers 22CF259, 21CF653, 21CF37, 21CF376, 20CM1218)
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Robert L Brooks. Defense requests an updated phone number and requests a new pretrial and status conference date. 
In 22CF259: Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
In all files: Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 4-13-22 at 1:30 PM. 
A status conference is scheduled for 5-16-22 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with R.R., H.R. or their residence.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(Covers 22CF259, 21CF653, 21CF37, 21CF376, 20CM1218)

8:59 AM cases 22CF259, 20CM1218, 21CF37, 21CF653, 21CF376 called. 
Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert L Brooks in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook not in court. 
Defense advises they have not spoke to their attorney. State requests $7500 cash bond to cover all files. Defendant makes a statement. Court orders $1000 cash bond to cover all files with previous conditions to apply to all. 
All files scheduled for a hearing on 3/28/2022 at 8:30 AM (Initial appearance in 22CF259). Notice to be sent to Attorney Katherine Cook.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(11:59 AM cases 20CM1218, 21CF37, 21CF376, 21CF653, 22CF259 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert L Brooks does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Katherine Cook for Robert L Brooks does not appear in court or via Zoom.
Court orders the warrants in cases 20CM1218, 21CF37, 21CF376, 21CF653 remain and orders a warrant in 22CF259.
